name: Bolt.new
description: Bolt.new is an AI-powered platform for creating, running, and deploying full-stack web applications directly in the browser.
longDescription: Bolt.new is an innovative AI-powered web development platform designed to simplify the creation of full-stack web applications by allowing users to generate, edit, and deploy code directly in the browser. Developed by StackBlitz, it leverages WebContainers technology to provide a secure, in-browser development environment without the need for local setups. The platform supports a wide range of JavaScript frameworks and integrates with tools like Figma, Netlify, and Supabase, making it accessible to developers, designers, and non-coders alike. Its mission is to streamline prototyping, development, and deployment, enabling users to transform ideas into functional apps quickly. By combining natural language prompts with real-time code execution, Bolt.new empowers users to iterate rapidly and deploy production-ready applications with minimal effort. It’s particularly valuable for those seeking to prototype ideas or build scalable web solutions efficiently.
features: AI-driven code generation allows users to create complex web applications from simple text prompts, saving development time.
In-browser development environment powered by WebContainers enables running Node.js, installing npm packages, and testing APIs without local setup.
One-click deployment to platforms like Netlify or Cloudflare simplifies publishing applications with no server configuration needed.
Figma integration converts design files into production-ready code, enhancing designer-developer collaboration.
Real-time collaboration features enable multiple users to work on projects simultaneously, similar to Google Docs.
Supports popular JavaScript frameworks like React, Next.js, Vue, and Svelte, ensuring flexibility for diverse project needs.
Error detection and auto-fixing by the AI assistant help resolve coding issues quickly, improving development efficiency.
Offline support allows developers to continue working without an internet connection, enhancing productivity.
Open-source codebase enables developers to build custom AI-powered tools using Bolt’s framework and WebContainer API.

faqs.question: What is Bolt.new?
faqs.answer: Bolt.new is an AI-powered platform that allows users to create, edit, and deploy full-stack web applications directly in the browser using natural language prompts and WebContainers technology.

faqs.question: Is Bolt.new free to use?
faqs.answer: Bolt.new offers a free plan with daily AI token limits, with paid subscriptions available for more tokens and private projects.

faqs.question: What frameworks does Bolt.new support?
faqs.answer: Bolt.new supports popular JavaScript frameworks like React, Next.js, Vue, Svelte, and more, as long as they run on StackBlitz’s WebContainers.

faqs.question: Can non-developers use Bolt.new?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-developers can use Bolt.new to create apps via simple prompts, though some technical knowledge enhances the experience for complex projects.

faqs.question: How does Bolt.new handle deployment?
faqs.answer: Bolt.new offers one-click deployment to platforms like Netlify, streamlining the process without requiring complex hosting configurations.

faqs.question: Does Bolt.new support team collaboration?
faqs.answer: Yes, Bolt.new provides real-time collaboration features, allowing multiple users to work on the same project simultaneously.

faqs.question: Can Bolt.new work offline?
faqs.answer: Yes, Bolt.new supports offline development, allowing users to continue coding without an internet connection.

faqs.question: How does Bolt.new integrate with Figma?
faqs.answer: Bolt.new connects with Figma to translate design components into responsive web code, enabling rapid prototyping and collaboration.
